== Announcement ==

The unveiling of the Galaxy Nexus was postponed from the 5th of October due to the death of [[Steve Jobs]].
The unveiling of the Galaxy Nexus was postponed from the 5th of October due to the death of [[Steve Jobs]].
Before the unveiling, there had been repeated leaks of various details on the upcoming new Google phone.<ref>{{cite web|url= http://www.engadget.com/2011/10/06/samsung-galaxy-nexus-specs-leak-headed-to-verizon-as-an-exclusi|title=Samsung Galaxy Nexus specs leak, headed to Verizon as an exclusive? (updated)|work=endgadget.com|author=Joseph Volpe |date=October 6, 2011}}</ref> Specifications on the phone varied including information about the processor and the camera.

(updated)|work=endgadget.com|author=Joseph Volpe |date=October 6, 2011}}</ref> Specifications on the phone varied including information about the processor and the camera.

The Galaxy Nexus features a 4.65-inch 1280Ã720-pixel HD [[Super AMOLED]] [[PenTile]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.slashgear.com/galaxy-nexus-has-curved-pentile-oled-display-21189996 |title=Galaxy Nexus has curved PenTile OLED display |publisher=SlashGear |date= |accessdate=2011-10-27}}</ref> curved glass display,<ref name="engadget20111006"/> a dual-core 1.2 GHz [[Texas Instruments OMAP|TI OMAP]] 4460 processor (ARM Cortex-A9)<ref name="bgr20111006"/> with an accompanying [[PowerVR]] SGX540,<ref>[http://focus.ti.com/general/docs/wtbu/wtbuproductcontent.tsp?contentId=53243&navigationId=12843&templateId=6123 OMAPâ¢ 4 Platform: OMAP4430/OMAP4460]. Focus.ti.com. Retrieved on 2011-11-21.</ref> 1 GB of RAM. The processor can run from 1.2â1.5 GHz, but is underclocked at 1.2 GHz for smooth performance. However, it can easily run at 1.5 GHz once rooted (see [[Texas_Instruments_OMAP#OMAP_4|Texas Instruments OMAP]]). Additionally, a 1,750 [[Ampere-hour|mAh]] battery, 1.3 MP front camera and 5 MP rear camera(with zero shutter lag<ref>[http://terrrra.com/?q=zero%20shutter%20lag%20nexus%20prime Search Online]. Terrrra.com. Retrieved on 2011-11-21.</ref>) capable of [[1080p]] video,<ref>[http://www.engadget.com/2011/10/19/samsung-galaxy-nexus-camera-and-1080p-video-samples/ Samsung Galaxy Nexus camera and 1080p video samples]. Engadget. Shugalmela.com (2011-10-20). Retrieved on 2011-11-21.</ref>
